edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class PowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.PowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PowerUp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is for powerup items that the player can pick up in the game. It contains code for the spawn location of items, their effects, and their positions, and their related fields and methods.
    Author:
    Pink Panthers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean isAmmo
      This field is defaulted at false and set to true in setEffect() if the player picks up the appropriate item.
      private boolean isRadar
      This field is defaulted at false and set to true in setEffect() if the player picks up the radar.
      private int itemCol
      These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty.
      private int itemID
      This field represents the itemID, which is needed to set the effects of the specific items in setEffect().
      private int itemRow
      These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty.
      private int possibleColSpawn
      These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.
      private int possibleRowSpawn
      These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.
      private int turnsInvincible
      This field represents the number of turns remaining that the player is invincible, which is defaulted at 0 and is set to 5 in setEffect().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PowerUp(int itemID)
      This constructor instantiates the items' fields: itemID, turnsInvincible, isRadar, and isAmmo.

      void checkItemPosition(boolean isSame, int nextPlayerRow, int nextPlayerCol)
      This method checks the position of items and the player.
      boolean getIsAmmo()
      This method retrieves whether the ammo item has been triggered.
      boolean getIsRadar()
      This method retrieves whether the radar has been triggered.
      int getItemCol()
      This retrieves the itemCol of the item.
      int getItemID()
      This method returns the itemID, used for displaying the different items.
      int getItemRow()
      This retrieves the itemRow of the item.
      int getPossibleCS()
      This method returns possibleColSpawn
      int getPossibleRS()
      This method returns possibleRowSpawn
      int getTurnsInvinc()
      This method retrieves the number of turns invincible that are remaining.
      void reduceTurnsInvinc()
      This method simply reduces the turnsInvincible.
      void resetItems()
      This makes sure the items don't respawn or can't be triggered more than once by resetting the values of isRadar to false and isAmmo to false.
      void setEffect()
      This method contains the effects of the items once the player encounters them.
      void spawnItem()
      After ensuring that the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are empty through the GameEngine class, this saves the items' positions, setting itemRow and itemCol.
      void spawnPossibleLocation()
      This method locates possible spawn locations for the items.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • possibleRowSpawn

        private int possibleRowSpawn
        These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.

      • possibleColSpawn

        private int possibleColSpawn
        These fields represent the possible spawning positions of the items, which are randomized in spawnPossibleLocation() and are used to ensure the location is empty enough to be placed.

      • itemRow

        private int itemRow
        These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty. These values can be retrieved in getItemRow() and #geItemCol().

      • itemCol

        private int itemCol
        These fields represent the actual positions of the items; the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are saved after the position is verified as empty. These values can be retrieved in getItemRow() and #geItemCol().

      • itemID

        private int itemID
        This field represents the itemID, which is needed to set the effects of the specific items in setEffect().

      • turnsInvincible

        private int turnsInvincible
        This field represents the number of turns remaining that the player is invincible, which is defaulted at 0 and is set to 5 in setEffect(). They are reduced every turn at reduceTurnsInvinc() and the value can be retrieved using getTurnsInvinc().

      • isAmmo

        private boolean isAmmo
        This field is defaulted at false and set to true in setEffect() if the player picks up the appropriate item.

      • isRadar

        private boolean isRadar
        This field is defaulted at false and set to true in setEffect() if the player picks up the radar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerUp

        public PowerUp(int itemID)
        This constructor instantiates the items' fields: itemID, turnsInvincible, isRadar, and isAmmo.
        Parameters:
        itemID -

    • Method Detail

      • spawnPossibleLocation

        public void spawnPossibleLocation()
        This method locates possible spawn locations for the items. It randomizes the positions, possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn

      • spawnItem

        public void spawnItem()
        After ensuring that the possibleRowSpawn and possibleColSpawn are empty through the GameEngine class, this saves the items' positions, setting itemRow and itemCol.

      • checkItemPosition

        public void checkItemPosition(boolean isSame,
                              int nextPlayerRow,
                              int nextPlayerCol)
        This method checks the position of items and the player. If it is the same, it calls setEffect().
        Parameters:
        isSame - is true when the player's future positions match the items' positions
        nextPlayerRow - is the player's future row position
        nextPlayerCol - is the player's future column position

      • setEffect

        public void setEffect()
        This method contains the effects of the items once the player encounters them. Depending on the itemID, (0) sets the turnsInvincible value to 5, (1) sets isRadar to true, and (2) sets the isAmmo to true.

      • resetItems

        public void resetItems()
        This makes sure the items don't respawn or can't be triggered more than once by resetting the values of isRadar to false and isAmmo to false.

      • reduceTurnsInvinc

        public void reduceTurnsInvinc()
        This method simply reduces the turnsInvincible.

      • getItemID

        public int getItemID()
        This method returns the itemID, used for displaying the different items.
        Returns:
        itemID

      • getPossibleRS

        public int getPossibleRS()
        This method returns possibleRowSpawn
        Returns:
        possibleRowSpawn

      • getPossibleCS

        public int getPossibleCS()
        This method returns possibleColSpawn
        Returns:
        possibleColSpawn

      • getItemRow

        public int getItemRow()
        This retrieves the itemRow of the item.
        Returns:
        itemRow

      • getItemCol

        public int getItemCol()
        This retrieves the itemCol of the item.
        Returns:
        itemRow

      • getTurnsInvinc

        public int getTurnsInvinc()
        This method retrieves the number of turns invincible that are remaining.
        Returns:
        turnsInvincible

      • getIsRadar

        public boolean getIsRadar()
        This method retrieves whether the radar has been triggered.
        Returns:
        isRadar

      • getIsAmmo

        public boolean getIsAmmo()
        This method retrieves whether the ammo item has been triggered.
        Returns:
        isAmmo
